body_content.explanation: something that is used to support or connect things, or to make something stronger:
examples: He was recently fitted with a brace for his bad back.

body_content.explanation: a set of connected wires that is attached to a person's teeth in order to make them straight:
examples: I had to wear a brace for my crooked teeth when I was a teenager.

body_content.explanation: a pair of narrow straps that stretch from the front of the trousers over your shoulders to the back to hold them up:
supports that are fastened to the legs of people who have difficulties with walking:
examples: The photos don't show the heavy steel braces that meant he could walk despite this condition.

body_content.explanation: two things of the same type, especially two wild birds that have been killed for sport or food:
to support an object in order to stop it from falling down:
examples: The side wall of the old house was braced with a wooden support.

body_content.explanation: to prepare yourself physically or mentally for something unpleasant:
examples: The passengers were told to brace themselves (= to press their bodies hard against something or hold them very stiff) for a crash landing.
